text: I would be surprised if Betfair removes runners within 5 minutes of jump time, and that may be within 15 minutes (they did not do it when I had a horse racing system running for a client)

elements.text: I would be surprised if Betfair removes runners within 5 minutes of jump time, and that may be within 15 minutes (they did not do it when I had a horse racing system running for a client)

text: Huh? Still need to handle non runners when simulating regardless, not that rare that they remove just before start

elements.text: Huh? Still need to handle non runners when simulating regardless, not that rare that they remove just before start

text: Agreed. Happens all the time and always has.

elements.text: Agreed. Happens all the time and always has.

text: That's a change from what used to happen on Australian racing. They would leave the runners in for very late scratchings rather than suspend and "re-frame" the market

elements.text: That's a change from what used to happen on Australian racing. They would leave the runners in for very late scratchings rather than suspend and "re-frame" the market

text: But the runner will then be removed after the race has finished, you then still need to calculate the adjustment factor of any orders placed before the withdrawal so it makes no difference

elements.text: But the runner will then be removed after the race has finished, you then still need to calculate the adjustment factor of any orders placed before the withdrawal so it makes no difference

text: Of course, but that is a different proposition to the runner being removed while you are betting

text: How is it different? Plenty of betting in running

text: Both things happen frequently - runners are removed in the last few minutes with suspension and re-forming and others are removed from the market after the race after having refused to start or caused a problem of some kind. This is not new.

elements.text: Both things happen frequently - runners are removed in the last few minutes with suspension and re-forming and others are removed from the market after the race after having refused to start or caused a problem of some kind. This is not new.

text: Hi All.. Stumbled upon the betfairlightweight library recently, and so just starting out trying to write my own Betfair bot. Slowly trawling through the history of these slack channels to pick up some info. Quick Q - I got an idea for a strategy that involves intra market trading across a horse races Win/EW/Place(s) markets. I'm confused as to whether I should be coding it with Flumine, or Betfairlightweight? What's the guide on choosing Flumine or just rely on betfairlight?

elements.text: Hi All.. Stumbled upon the betfairlightweight library recently, and so just starting out trying to write my own Betfair bot. Slowly trawling through the history of these slack channels to pick up some info. Quick Q - I got an idea for a strategy that involves intra market trading across a horse races Win/EW/Place(s) markets. I'm confused as to whether I should be coding it with Flumine, or Betfairlightweight? What's the guide on choosing Flumine or just rely on betfairlight?

text: If you’re starting out go with Flumine

elements.text: If you’re starting out go with Flumine

text: Yeah need to improve the readme on flumine, bflw is a wrapper for the API and flumine is a fully functioning trading framework which happens to use bflw

elements.text: Yeah need to improve the readme on flumine, bflw is a wrapper for the API and flumine is a fully functioning trading framework which happens to use bflw

text: Is there any limit on the number of markets that can be monitored/refreshed? e.g could I scan the current day of race markets (so approx say 3 markets per race, however many UK/IRE races per day)?

elements.text: Is there any limit on the number of markets that can be monitored/refreshed? e.g could I scan the current day of race markets (so approx say 3 markets per race, however many UK/IRE races per day)?

text: Is there problems viewing P&L today? I can't see anything more than 3 hrs ago

elements.text: Is there problems viewing P&L today? I can't see anything more than 3 hrs ago

text: They have broken the web interface for P&L apparently but the API operations to get settled orders is working fine for me.

elements.text: They have broken the web interface for P&L apparently but the API operations to get settled orders is working fine for me.

text: There is no technical limitation and this would work fine. There are restrictions imposed by Betfair to prevent wholesale scraping of data but these can easily be removed on request. I’d be surprised if you’d hit those limits with something focused on UK and Irish facing however

text: <@U4H19D1D2>, <@ULDAVFDRP> - yep, the difference is that I was thinking about live trades, where Betfair makes all the adjustments for the current bets returned by the stream (and all the settled bets to a point). Of course when you are simulating you need to do these adjustments yourself
